dc:title: On Pilgrimage - July/August 1974
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Ill in bed, she tells of the immanent move to a new Maryhouse for women. Describes their farm as a "village", remembers three workers who died, and recalls the pacifist witness of Ammon Hennacy and his gentle personality.
